name: IF-UpdateClickOnce
description: Gives you the ability to modify some properties on a ClickOnce Package.
author: Peter Helje
helpMarkDown: Enables modification of Application Name, Version number, Minimum version and [more](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=IfPCInsuranceSE.UpdateClickOncePackage)

inputs.name: ApplicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name that is used to identify the application. ClickOnce will use this name to identify the application in the Start menu

inputs.name: Publisher
inputs.label: Publisher
inputs.helpMarkDown: Changes the publisher name to the description element of the application manifest.

inputs.name: Certificate
inputs.label: Certificate file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the location of an digital certificate file for signing. You should use secure files feature for this.

inputs.name: CertificatePassword
inputs.label: Certificate Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The certificate password if needed, You should use a secret variable here.

inputs.name: ProviderUrl
inputs.label: Provider Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the URL which ClickOnce will examine for application updates.

inputs.name: ApplicationFolder
inputs.label: Application folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where the ClickOnce build is located.

inputs.name: Version
inputs.label: ClickOnce Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the deployment. The argument must contain a valid version string of the format N.N.N.N

inputs.name: MinVersion
inputs.label: Minimum required version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The minimum version of this application a user can run. This flag makes the named version of your application a required update, use %version% to use the current version as minimum. The argument must contain a valid version string of the format N.N.N.N

inputs.name: Advanced
inputs.label: Advanced XML modification
inputs.helpMarkDown: Here you can supply a JSON string that will be used to modify the specified node value in the .application file. Se default value for example JSON structure and required properties. Use # for comments
